docs.snippet: Whispered questions among business leaders over the weekend produced no clear consensus on what to say about the President Trump’s immigration order in public.

headline.print_headline: Frantic Phoning Among C.E.O.s: How to Address Trump Ban?
headline.main: Frantic Phoning Among C.E.O.s: How to Address Trump Ban?

docs.snippet: Determined to make legal resistance a defining attribute of the Trump era, lawyers have been putting aside institutional rivalries and working together on litigation.

headline.print_headline: Lawyers Join Forces and Fan Out to Fight Trump Policies
headline.main: Liberal Lawyers Plan Wave of Resistance to Trump Policies

docs.snippet: Tuesday: Breaking a sweat at the Met, plenty of protests, and hundreds of thousands of noise complaints.

headline.print_headline: New York Today: Squats and Statues
headline.main: New York Today: Squats and Statues

docs.snippet: Relationships between Iraqis and Americans have long been nurtured against a backdrop of war. Now Iraqis wonder if betrayal and insult will define the dynamic.

headline.print_headline: Relationship Recast as U.S. Turns Away
headline.main: ‘You Have Let Us Down, Trump’: Iraqis See U.S. Relations Recast

docs.snippet: “Open society, pluralism, no discrimination. They are the pillars of Europe,” Italy’s prime minister said, reflecting a stance taken across the Continent.

headline.main: European Leaders Reject Trump’s Refugee Ban as Violating Principles

docs.snippet: Senators tore up their schedules over the weekend to join protesters in airport concourses and give voice to the growing fury over President Trump’s policies.

headline.print_headline: As Democrats Flood the Streets, Their Representatives Rush to Keep Up
headline.main: As Democrats Take to the Streets, Lawmakers Rush to Keep Up

docs.snippet: After years of long-distance dating, the wedding was delayed by hundreds of thousands marching in Manhattan.

headline.main: They Waited 5 Years (and 45 Minutes) to Marry

docs.snippet: Silence in the capitals of some Muslim-majority countries unaffected by the order reflected a lack of solidarity and an enduring uncertainty about Mr. Trump’s intentions.

headline.print_headline: Heads of Muslim Nations Not Targeted Are Conspicuously Silent
headline.main: In Face of Trump’s Order, Some Muslim Nations Are Conspicuously Silent

docs.snippet: Roller rinks like Skate World in Oregon still strengthen our social fabric.
Presidential denial is an even bigger threat than transparent lying.

headline.print_headline: Can Mr. Trump Handle the Truth?
headline.main: Can Donald Trump Handle the Truth?
